text:
WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Emily Oakenfold
Address: Melton, Sask.
Birthplace: Lambeth, London, Eng.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in eastern Canada? 1906
Where did you set up housekeeping? Melton, Sask., on homestead
Where had you been living before that? Brandon, Man.
For how many people did you prepare meals? Four
How far was it to your nearest store? Fifty miles from Hanley
How often could a visit be made to the store? Three times a year
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Flour, sugar, salt, yeast, vegetable from neighbors, soap, matches.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Lake of Woods
In what quantities did you buy it? 300 pounds
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.50
How much did you use graham flour? Very little
Whole wheat flour? Small lots
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? What year?
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 65¢
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? Yes
Whole wheat? Yes
Farina? No
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Some times
How did you grind it? Coffee grinder
Oakenfold, Mrs. Emily
Weldon, 1906

1. INTERROGATION

That year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? 1906. Yes.

Where did you get your housekeeping? From Mr. Smith.

Have you had any living before that? No.

For how many people did you prepare meals?

How far was it to your nearest store?

How often could a visit be made to the store?

What provisions did you buy in your own stores?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

Have you used white flour all your life?

In what quantities did you buy it?

Was there any flour purchased from Mr. Smith?

How much did you use per month?

Was flour milled locally?

Has flour milled locally?

That was the price for a ton of flour?

What other products did you purchase?

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge?

How did you grind it?
3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy white sugar? ........................................... 10 lbs.

What was the price for a ten pound sack of white sugar? ......................... $0.50

What brand of golden corn syrup did you use? ...................................... Made with brown sugar

What size of tin of syrup did you usually buy? ...........................................

At what price? ........................................................................................

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days? ......................... Canned milk for 5¢ per quart

Butter? .................................................................................................. 2½ pounds

Eggs? ..................................................................................................... Fresh and brown

What was the price of butter? .................................................................. 5¢ per pound

Did you pack eggs for winter? ................................................................. Yes

How? ..................................................................................................... In boxes

Did you make butter? ............................................................................. No

Cheese? .................................................................................................. No

What kind of cheese? .............................................................................. None

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years? ........................................ Salt pork

How did you get fresh meat? .................................................................... Got it at an 1808 farm

How often did you get fresh meat? ............................................................ Twice a week

How did you preserve meat? .................................................................... Freeze pork & pack in salt

Was there a "beef ring" in your neighborhood? ......................................... Yes

If so what year was it organized? ............................................................. 1920

Did you use game? .................................................................................. Yes

What kinds? ............................................................................................ None

For how long? ......................................................................................... None

What part did fish play in the family diet? ................................................ Very little

Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned? ....................................................... Canned

Kinds? .................................................................................................... Salt Cod
3. SUGARS AND SYRUPS

In what quantity did you buy? (Also sugar) ... 1 lb. 6 oz.

What was the price for a cup? (pound sack of white sugar?) ... 40¢

What brand of molasses syrup did you use? ... American, brown sugar

What size of tin or syrup did you usually buy?

At what price?

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days?

Did you make butter? ... Yes

That was the price of butter? ... 25¢

Did you pack eggs for winter? ... No

Did you make cheese? ... Yes

What kind of cheese?

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early days?

How did you get fresh meat? ... From the market

How often did you get fresh meat? ... Weekly

How did you preserve meat? ... Salted, then packed in ice

Was there a "meat ring" in your neighborhood? ... Yes

If so, what year was it organized? ... 1920

Did you own cows? ... Yes

For how long? ... Many years

What part did fish play in the family diet? ... Very little

Was the fish fresh, canned, or smoked? ... Fresh

Kind? ... Cod
6. BEVERAGES

What kind of tea did you buy? Black tea. At what price? $15.75.

What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) Ground.

Price? ................. That other beverages were used? .................

7. VEGETABLES AND DRIED FRUITS

What was the price of potatoes per bushel when you set up housekeeping?

Could you get potatoes at the store? Yes.

If not, where from? From the neighbor.

What year did you first grow your own supply for the winter of?

Potatoes 1924-7, Cabbages 1924-7, Carrots 1924-7, Onions 1924-7,

Turnips 1924-7, Beets 1924-7.

In what quantities did you buy white navy beans? 20 lbs.

How did you buy prunes, (in bulk or by the box)? By the box.

What weight? 25 lbs.

How did the grocer handle prunes (by box)? ...

What was the price of prunes? $3.00.

What other dried fruits did you use in the earliest days? (apples, pears, apricots, peaches, loganberries, raisins, currants or others)?

Apples, raisins, currants.

8. PRESERVING

In the early years did you preserve any foods by drying? Peas? Corn? Beans? Saskatoons?

Other foods? ................................................................

That year did you first preserve fruit by canning? 1924-7.

That year did you first preserve vegetables by canning? 1924-7.

That year did you first preserve meat by canning? 1924-7.

Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying? Yes.

To what extent? Fairly extensive.

Did you make your own vinegar? Yes.
6. **NEW VEGETABLES**
   - What kind of turn did you buy? 
   - What kind of outdoor did you buy? (Please or present)
   - Other vegetables

7. **VARIETIES AND QUANTITIES**
   - What was the price of potatoes per bushel?
   - Could you get potatoes at the store?
   - If not, where from?
   - What year did you first grow your own supply for the Cluster of:
     - Potatoes
     - Turnips
     - Radishes
   - In what quantities did you buy potatoes? (in bulk or by the box)?
   - How did you buy potatoes? (in bulk or by the box)?
   - What weight?
   - What was the price of potatoes?

8. **FREEZING**
   - In the early years did you preserve any foods by freezing?
   - What year did you first preserve fruit by canning?
   - What year did you first preserve vegetables by canning?
   - Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying?

9. **TO WHAT EXTENT?**
   - Did you make your own vinegar?

10. Baking

What type of yeast did you use? potato yeast

Did you make yeast for your own use? Yes

Using starter? Yes

Using hops? Yes

Salt rising?

Did you buy baking powder? Yes

Baking soda? Yes

Cream of tartar? Yes

Did you make your own baking powder? No

12. WATER SUPPLY

Where did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (well, river, slough, dugout) ... Slough sewage treatment plant ...

How far was this water from your home? ... 1/2 mile ...

How was it brought to the home? (pail, barrel, tank) ... pail & barrel ...

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.
13. SOAPS

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Made own.

If you made your own, did you use lye? Yes, wood ashest.

What kinds of laundry soap did the grocer handle? Detergents.

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? Wood.

Where did you get your fuel? Lake Washington.

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

Coal & Wood of late years

15. METHODS OF COOKING AND TYPES OF UTENSILS

For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days? (Give dates) No.

Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates)

By whom was your first cook stove made? Don't know.

What year was it purchased? 1904. Price? $200.

What types of utensils did you use? (Iron, copper, tin, homemade) Iron, Tin, Enamel.

For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other) China, earthenware, wooden bowls.

When did you first see enamel ware? Around 1912.

Aluminum? 1919.
13. **FIREWOOD**
   - Did you buy firewood? If so, where did you get it?
   - Did you use any other type of fuel?

   - Did you keep any animals for food?

16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

pork & potatoes bread &
salt cod eggs & tea

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? ...1946....... Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

Salt pork frozen potatoes & cabbage
plum pudding bread butter
tea
Elder's age of 4 ran between 25 & 30 yrs
2 children of 7 yrs & 6 yrs

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

No.
17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the location.

pork & potatoes fried & salt pork frozen potatoes & cabbage

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? Give the menu. List those present and give their ages.

19. Were you ever refused or made starvation level living so we could produce food? If so, state.
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homgrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].
21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and homemade foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

22. Please add other details in new rows below concerning the buying, storage, and serving foods in other ways during the war. Include any additional above, quality methods of purchasing, problems of storage, shortages and other details. (Use back of page II more space if needed).
